intro: Cousinia tashkurghanica, commonly known as the Tashkurgan cousinia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Xinjiang, China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss, while its flowers are small and clustered. Cousinia tashkurghanica is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
